intro: Buccaferrea × variifolia, commonly known as the variable buccaferrea, is a hybrid shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in partially shaded to sunny conditions. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to adapt to various garden environments. The species is also noted for its ecological importance, providing habitat and food for native pollinators and birds.
